Sentencas: One of the major reasons resulting in the performance degradation of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is the poisoning of the cathode by gas-phase chromium (Cr6+) volatilized from alloy interconnects.
Titulo: Research Progress on the Mechanism of Chromium Poisoning in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Cathode

Sentencas: The mechanism of chromium poisoning in SOFC cathode has not been clarified.
Titulo: Research Progress on the Mechanism of Chromium Poisoning in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Cathode

Sentencas: Electrochemical mechanism states that Cr6+ has participated in the electrochemical reduction reaction of cathodic oxygen, and deposited at the interface of triple-phases boundary (TPB).
Titulo: Research Progress on the Mechanism of Chromium Poisoning in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Cathode

Sentencas: Whereas chemical mechanism considers that nucleation effect results in the poisoning of SOFC cathode.
Titulo: Research Progress on the Mechanism of Chromium Poisoning in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Cathode

Sentencas: Nucleating agent in the cathode is the determinant of Cr deposition.
Titulo: Research Progress on the Mechanism of Chromium Poisoning in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Cathode

Sentencas: In this paper, the research process of chromium poisoning in SOFC cathodes in the recent ten years is reviewed, with a focus on the effects of the transport properties of the cathode and electrolyte materials.
Titulo: Research Progress on the Mechanism of Chromium Poisoning in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Cathode
